name: Pakistan Intellectual Property Rights Organization Ordinance,2005
tagline: To provide for the protection of Intellectual Property Rights in Pakistan

PUBLISHED BY AUTHORTTY
ISLAMABAD, MONDAI APRIL 11, 2OO5
PART I
Acts, Ordinances, President's Orders and Regulations
COVERNMENT OF PAKISTAN
MINISTRY OF LAW, JUSTICE, HUMAN RIGHTS ANI)
PARLIAMENTARY AFFAIRS
(Law, Justice and Human Rights Division)
lslantabad' the 8th APril, 2005
No, F. 2(1)/2005'Pub'-The following Ordinance promulgated by the
President is hereby published fbr general information :-
Onotrue.Ncs No. V oe 2005
AN
ORDINANCE
to provide.for tlrc establishntent of Pakistan lntellectual Property Rights
Organization
WHrnees it is expedient to establish the Pakistan Intellectual Property Rights
Organization to provide for the protection oflntellectual Property Rights in Pakistan
and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto:
(7e)
Pice : Rs. 10 .50127 7 4(2O05't lBx. G az.)
THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL ll, 2005 [Panrl
Now' rHsnrponr. in exercise of the powers confened upon him by clause
(1) of Article 89 ofthe Constitution ofrhe Islamic Republic ofPakistan, the President
is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:- .
l Short title, extent and commencement.-( I ) This Ordinance may
be called the Pakistan Intellectual Property Rights Organization Ordinance,2005.
(3) It shall come into force at once
2. Definitions.-In this Ordinance, unless there is any thing repugnant
in the subject or context,-
(a) "Board" means the Policy Board constituted under section 4,
(b) "Director General"
under section 8;means the Director General rippointed
(e)"member" means a member of the Board;
"Organization" means the Pakistan Intellectual property Rights
Organization established under section 3;
"prescribed" means prescribed by rules;
"rules" means the rules made under this Ordinance;.ald
"Schedule" means a schedule to this Ordinance.(0
3. Establishment of the Organization,-( 1) There shall be established
an organization to be known as Pakistan Intellectual property Rights Organization
to carry out the purposes of this Ordinance.G)
(h)
(r)80
ANo wssnses the National Assembly is not in session and the President is
satislied that circumstances exist which render it necessary to take immediate steps.
(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.
(c) "federal Government" means the Cabinet Division;
(d) "Intellectual Property" includes a patent industrial design,layout-design
ofintegrated circuits, copyright, trade mark, trade name, trade secrets,
technical know-how and ideas for new products and market including
the commercial information about customer or anv combination
thereof:
PARr ll THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL ll, 2005 8l
(2) The Organization shall be abody corporate having perpetual succession
and a common seal with powers, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to hold
and dispose ofthe property both movable and immovable and shall by the said name
sue and be sued.
(3) The Federal Govemment may set-up regional offices ofthe Organization
at such places as and when required.
4. Policy Board.-( 1) The Federal Government shall, by notification in
the official Gazette, constitute a Policy Board consisting of the Chairman. Vice-
Chairman and such other members as it may deem fit.
(2) Notwithstanding the composition ofthe Board constituted under sub-
- section (l), the Federal Government may increase or decrease the number of
members and prescribe the qualifications and mode and manner oftheir appointment.
(3) The Director General shall act as ex oflwio Secretary ofthe Board
5. Functions and powers of the Board.-(1) The Board shall be
responsible for policy guidelines and setting ofobjectives as it may deem necessary
for the smooth functioning ofthe Orghnization.
(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality ofthe foregoing
powers, the Board shall,-
(a) promote a modern system for the protection of Intellectual Property
Rights in Pakistan:
(b) approve policies, plans and programmes of the Organization; and
(c) formulate procedures and necessary framework for utilization offunds
generated or acquired through services, donations or grants, etc.
6. Delegation of Powers.-The Board niay, by general or special order
in writing subject to such limitations, restrictions or conditions, delegate all or any of
its powers and functions to the Director General or any committee of the Board, as
may be constituled for the purpose. as it may deem appropriate.
7. Meetings of the Board.-( l) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board
shall regulate the procedure for its meetings.
(2) The Federal Government may convene the meeting of the Board at
any time on any urgent matter requiring decision by the Board.
82 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL 11, 2OO5 [PATI
(3) The meeting of the Board shall be held at least twice a year
(4) A simple majority of the total membership shall constitute the quorum
for a meeting of the Board.
(5) The decision ofthe Board shall be adopted by simple majority ofthe
Members present and voting.
8. Director General.-(l) There shall be a Director General of the
Organization who shall be appointed by the Federal Government on tems and
conditions as may be prescribed.
(3) The Director General shall comply with such directions that the Federal
Govemment or the Board may give from time to time.
9. The powers and functions of the Organization.-The powers and
functions of the Organization shall be to:-
(b) prescribe, regulate or implement measures and standards on any matter
related to or connected with intellectual property,
(c) accredit or certify and regulate .any person as intellectual property
Agent;
(d) appoint such employees, consultants and experts as deemed necessary
on terms and conditions prescribed by the Federal Government;
(e) levy such charges or fees as may be reasonable for services and
facilities provided by the Organization and its constituent offices;
(0 carry out such other works or activities as may appear to the
Organization to be necessary, with a view to making the best use of
the assets of the organization;
(g) engage, in conjunction with other authorities, intemational agencies or
Organizations, in any study or cooperation project related to intellectual
property;(2) The Director General shall be the Chief Executive Officer of the ^
Organization and shall discharge such duties and perform such functions as are
assigned to him by or under this Ordinance.
(a) administer and coordinate all government systems for the protection
oflntellectual Property Rights under the laws specified in the Schedule
and the rules and regulations made thereunder;
Parr Il THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL ll,2m5 83
(h) enter into contracts for the supply of goods or materials or for the
execution of works as may be necessary for the discharge of any of
its duties and functions;
(i) supervise and coordinate the working ofall intellectual property offices
including the Patent Office Trade Ma*s Registry and Copyright Office;
() maintain a system to provide access to public documents and information
relating to any intellechral property kept or maintained by the office;
(k) advise the Government of Pakistan on policy relating to intellectual
property rights;
( 1) plan for future development and up-gradation ofthe intellectual propefty
infiastructure and capacity in Pakistan;
(m) initiate research in the field ofintellectual property;
(n) advise the Federal Govemment regarding the intemational negotiations
in the area of intellectual property;
(o) engage in human resource development of staff o_f all intellectual
property officesl
(p) promote awareness about intellectual property issues in the public and
private sector;
(q) liaise with counterpart and related technical organizations in other
countries;
(r) propose and initiate intellectual property rights legislation for the
protection ol intellectual property rights in Pakistan:
(s) monitor the enforcement and protection of intellectual property rights
and collect related data;
(t) develop working .manuals, references, materials and procedures in
order to assist in improving the protection ofintellegtual property rightsi
(u) coordinate the implementation of foreign-aided technical assistance
projects on intellectual property; and
(v) perform any other function relating to intellectual property assigned
by the Federal Covernment.
84 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL 11,2005 [PARr.l
10. Authentication of orders and other instruments of the
Organization.-All orders, decisions and all other instruments issued by the
Organization shall be authenticated only by the signatures ofsuch officer or officers
who are authorized by the Organization in this behalf.
11. Prohibition of improper use of mark of the Organization.-No
person shall use in relation to any article, product or process or in the title of any
patent or in any trade marks or design the mark of the Organization except under a
license or certificate issued under this Ordinance.
12. Prohibition of use of certain names, etc.-No persori shall without
the previous permission of the Organization and subject to such conditions as may
be prescribed, use-
(a) any name u,hich may resemble the name of the Organization contain
the expression or any abbreviation of such expression; or
(b) any mark or trade mark in relation to any aruticle containing the
expression "Pakistan Intellectual Property Rights Organization,' or any
abbreviation of such expression.
14. Certain matters to be kept confidential.-Any information coming
into notice of the Organization or any of its officers in relation to any article or
process, subject to the provision of this Ordinance or any other law for the time
being in force shall be treated as confidential and shall not be communicated or
revealed to any person:
Provided rhat nothing in this section shall apply to the disclosure of any
information for the purpose ofprosecution under this Ordinance.
15. Appointment of officers, etc., by the Organization.-( I ) The
Organization may, with the prior approval of the Board, create posts and appoint
such officers. employees, experts and consultants, as it may consider necessary for
the performance of its functions.
(2) The Organization, with the approval of the Board, shall devise
procedures fbr the appointment of its officers, employees experts and consultants.13. Exercise of powers of the Organization by other bodies.-The
Federal Government may, in consultation with the Organization, by notification in
the official Cazette, direct that any power exercisable by the Organization under this
Ordinance shall, in relation to such matters and subject to such conditions as may be
specified in the direction, be exercisable also by such body or such organization as
may be specified in the notification.
Perr ll THE GAZETTE.OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL 11,2005 85
(3) The Organization, with the approval of the Board, shall determine the
terms and conditions of service of its officers, employees, experts and consultants
and shall also be competent to take disciplinary action against them.
(4) The civil servants working in the Organization shall be govemed by
the Civil Servants Act, 1973 (LXXI of 1973), and rules made thereunder unless
absorbed in the Organization.
16. Members and officers, €tc,, to be public servants.-The Director
General. members, officers, employees, experts and consultants of the Organization
shall, when acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any of the provisions of this
Ordinance, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning ofsection 2t ofthe
Pakistan Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).
17. Pakistan lnte ectual Propcrty Rights Urgaruzatron t'uno.-( I )
There shall be created a fund to be kr,q,Jn as the Pakistan Intellectual Property
PJghts Organization Fund which shall vest in the Organization and shall be utilized
by the Organization to meet charges in connection with its functions under this
Ordinance including the payment of salaries and other remuneration to the Director
General. officers, employees, experts and consultants of the Organization.
(2) The Pakistan Intellectual Property Rights Organization Fund shall be
financed from the following sources, namely:-
(a) grants and loans made by the Federal Govemment;
(c) revenue earned from the levy of various fees by the Organization
18. Budget.-The Organization shall, in respect of each financial year
submit for approval of the Federal Govemment, on such date as may be prescribed,
a statement of the estimated receipts and expenditure, including requirements of
- foreign exchange for the next financial year.
19. Audit and Accounts.-(1) The accounts of the Organization shall
be maintained in the manner prescribed by the Controller General of Accounts.
(3) A copy of the audit report shall be sent to the Federal Govemment
alongwith the comments of lhe Organization.(b) loans, aid and donations from the national or international agencies;
and
(2) The Auditor.-General of Pakistan shall conduct audit of the accounts
ofthe Organiza(ion.
86 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL ll, 2005 [PenT I
(4) The Federal Government may issue directions to the Organization for'
the rectification of any item objected to by the Auditor-General of Pakistan and
the Organization shall comply with such directions.
20. Power to amend the Schedule.-The Federal Government may. by
notification in the official Gazette, rmend the Schedule so as to add any entry thereto
or modif y or omit any entry therefrom.
21. Mode of recoveiy.-Any sum payable to the Olganization under
this Ordinance shall be recoverable as an arrears of land revenue.
22. Submission of yearly reports and returns.-( 1) Within three months
ofthe conclusion ofeach financial year, the Board shall submit an Annual Report to
the Federal Covernment in respect of the activities of the Board including the srilrL
of its existing programmes, projects and further plans formulated in turtherance of
its aims and objectives.
(2) The Federal Govemment may requiie the Organization to furnish it
with,-
(a) any return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding
any matter under the control of the Organization:
(b) a report on any subject with which the Organization is concerned;
and
(c) a copy of any document in the charge of the Orgurization
23. Protection of action taken under the Ordinance.-No suit.
prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Federal Government or the
Organization or any person acting under the Federal Govemme,r_ or the Organization
for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this
Ordinance or any rule or regulation made thereunder.
24. Exemption from any provision of this Ordinance.-The Federal
Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any article or class
of articles from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance.
25. Policy directives.-The Federal Governmenr may, as and when it
considers necessary, issue policy directives to the Board in respect of its activities
and thepompliance of s.rch directives shall be binding on the Board.
26. Power to make rules. -The Federal Govemment may, by notification
in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Ordinarrce.
Parr IlTTIE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA.. APRIL II. 2005 87
Z7 . Power to make regulations._The Organization may, with theprevious approval ofthe Board, by notification in the official Gazette, make regulations
not inconsistent with this ordinance or the rures made thereunder to carqi out thepurposes of this Ordinance.
28. Integration of the Trade Marks Registry, Copyright Office andPatent oflice.-(1) upon the commencement of this ordinance. the Trade MarksRegistry. Copyright office and patent office hereinafter referred to as the saidoffices shall become part of the Organization, and,-
(a) all assets rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties,
movable -and immovable, cash and bank balance, reseive funds.
investment and all other interest and rights in, or arising out of such
properties and all debts, liabilities and obligations ofwhatever kind of
the said offices subsisting immediately before their integration shall
stand transfened to and vest in the Organization;
(b) all officers and other employees of the said offices shall.
notwithstanding anything contained in any law or in any agreement,
deed. document or other instrument, stand absorbed and tr ansterred
to the Organization and shall be deemed to have been appointed or
engaged by the Organization in accordance with the terms and
conditions which shall not be less favourable than in the said offices;
and no oflicer or other employce whose services are so absorbed and
transferred shall be entitled to alty compensation because of such
absorption or transfel
(c)
(d)all debts and obligations incurred or contracts enrered into or rights
acquired and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with oifor
the said offices before their integration, shall be deemed io have been
incurred, entered into, acquired or engaged to be done by or for, the
Orgtanizirtion; and
all suits and other legal proceedings instirured by or against thc saidoffices before their integration shall be deemed to be suits and
proceedings by or against the Organization and may be proceeded or
otherwise dealt with accordingly.
29. Removal of difficulties.-The Federal Governmert may, lbr rhepurpose of removing any difficulty, in relation to the absorption and transfer and
other matters specified in section 28, make such order as it considers expedient and
any such order shall be deemed to be, and given efTect to, 6 a part ofthi provisions
ot this Ordinance :
88 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL 11, 2005 [PARr I
Provided that no such power shall be exercised after the expiry of three
years from the commencement of this Ordinance,
THE SCHEDULE
[See section 9(a)]
l. The Trade Marks Ordinance,2001 (XIX of2001).
2. The Copyrights Ordinance, 1962 (XXXIV of 1962).
3. The Patents Ordinance, 2000 (LXI of 2000).
4. The Registered Designs Ordinance,2000 (XLV of 2000).
5. The Registered Layout-Designs oflntegrated Circuits Ordinance, 2000
(XLIX of 2000).
OnnrNeNce No. VI oe 2005
AN
ORDINANCE
.further lo atnend the Legal Practitioners and Bar Couttcils Act, 1973
WrrEnres it is expedient further to amend the Legal Practitioners and BaI
Councils Act, 1973 (XXXV of 1973). for the purposes hereinafter apperling;
AND WHEREAS the National Assembly is not in session and the President is
satist'ied that circumstances exist which render it necessary to take immediate action:
l. Short title and commencement etc,-(l) This Ordinance may be
called the Legal Plactitioners and Bar Councils (Amendment) Ordinance, 2005.
(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken
effect from the 3'd day of March, 2005.
(3) The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding
anything contained in any other law or rules for the time being in force.Now. rttrtrronr, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of ^Article 89 of the Constitution of the Islarnic Republic of Pakistan, the President is
pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-
2. Amendment of section 2, Act XXXV of 1973._ln the Legal
Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973 (XXXV of 1973), hereinafter referred to
as the said Act, in section 2,-Parr IlTHE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL II, 2OO5 E9
(l) clause (cc) shall be omifted;
(2) for clause (e), the following shall be substituted, namely:-
':(e) "legal practitioner" means an advocatet";
(3) after clause (k), the following new clauses shall be inserted, namely:_
"(kk) 'toll of group of districts" means a roll of advocates of a High
Court or, as the case may be, a roll of advocates practising in a. former revenue Diyision as existed on the 31., DecembeE 1999,
prepared and maintained by a provincial Bar Council under this
Act;
(kkk) "Schedule" means Schedule to this Act;"; and
(4) in clause (n)r for the full stop ar the end the semi-colon shall be
substituted and thereafter the following new clause shall be added,
narnely:-
"(o) "votcr" rlreans-
(i) in relation to election to a Provincial Bar Council. an
advocate whose name for the time being appears on the
roll of group of districts and to whom an identity card has
been issued by a Provincial Bar Council and who is not in
arrears of dues of the Provincial Bar Council for a period
exceeding six months; and
(ii) in relation to election to the Pakislan BarCouncil, a member
of a Provincial Bar Council.".
3. Amendment of section 5, Act XXXV of 1973.-In the said Act,
in section 5,-
(i) for sub-section (2), the following shall be substitured, namely:-
"(2) The number of members to be elected to following provincial
Bar Councils shall be as hereinafter provided, namely:-

(a) Punjab Bar Council .,. 75
SindhBarCouncil ... 32' N.W.F.P. Bar CouncH ... 28

(b) the district-wise allocation ofseats referred to in clause (a)
for respective Provincial Bar Councils shallbe in accordance
wirh rhe Schedule; and
(c) no seat of a Provincial Bar Council shall be increased in
future on the basis of increase in number of advocates of
respective Provincial Bar Council and seat allocated to a^
new district will be drawn from the district out of which it -
i! carved out."t
(ii) for sub-section (2A), the foltowing shall be substituted, namely:-
*(24)For the purpose ofelection of members ofaProvincial Bar Council
from a district or districts under sub-section (2) the advocates
entered on the roll of group of districts as mentioned in the
Schedule, shall constitute the electoral college.";
(in) sub-section (3), shall be omitted; and
(iv) in sub-section (4), for the word "Division" the words and commas
"district or, as the case may be, the group of districts" shall be
substituted.
4. Amendment of section 5A, Act XXXV of 1973.-ln the said Act,
in section 5A,-
(D for clause (a) the following shall be substituted, namely:-
"(a) is on the roll ofadvocates of High Coun maintained by a Provincial
Bar Council;"; and
(ii) in clause (b), for the word "seven" the word "ten" shall be substituted.
5. Amendment of section 9, Act XXXV of 1973.-ln the said Act, in
section 9, in sub-section (l ), in clause (a), for the word "Division" the word "district"
shall be substituted.
6. Addition of Schedule, Act XXXV of 1973.-In the said Act, at the
end, the following Schedule shall be added, namely:-
